Everything is good in this restaurant.  I love it so much, but their salads in particular are the best in all the valley.  I think its because they're plentiful and just plain delicious!  Beer and wine offerings are always very impressive.  This place is great for kids or even a casual date.  Or a girls date night.  Enjoy this locals spot in vegas.

This was my first time here. I arrived a little before my friend who is a regular here and I found a spot at the bar. I am the type who just wants a beer that the bartender recommends. Thankfully I lucked out and was greeted with a smile by Alan!! He was super friendly without even realizing I was meeting up with one of his regulars . That leads me to believe this is a place to come enjoy a beer with good company!! I decided to try their seasonal blueberry vanilla beer (yes! I know that sounds gross) it honestly was delicious and I enjoyed not just one but two of them! They have a variety of different options and the glasses come chilled!!!!!! Check it out if you're in the area and looking for a yummy beer with fun bartenders and interesting regulars .. I can't speak on the food or any of that just beer and crowd

Pros:
1. Friendly staff
2. Clean place
Cons: 
1. Warm beer
2. No vodka in my cranberry vodka
3. Very bland garlic knots 
4. Super greasy, making bread soggy
5. Horrible stomach ache

I was meeting an old friend of mine in Summerlin and wanted a good pizza and some beer. Bartender recommended the Scotch Ale. That was one of the better beers I've ever had! Moved over to the restaurant side and had the meat lover's deep dish pizza. Very good pizza and had two more Scotch Ales with dinner. Was there 2.5 hours and waiter treated us great checking on us when drinks needed refilling. Overall great place and would recommend to everyone!

Head upstairs for a quiet and frendly experience.  Brad does a great job of making new visitors feel welcome.  Cosy seating areas as well as small intimate bar area.
GREAT chicken strips.  Try things out during happy hour with good in house beers.

Probably the best Chicago deep dish pizza in Las Vegas.  Definitely beats B.J's deep dish, maybe Amore's...  not sure I think I have to go back to make sure since it's been a while.  The crust is amazing and for sure the best crust I've ever had in my life!  Also had the garlic knots which were decent.

Absolutely terrible food. Got ahi tuna salad, tuna was nearly frozen cold, tasted way too much like fish. Clearly not remotely fresh. French fries were stale as hell and cold. Never ever eating there again

Great place to eat/drink/watch sports. Happy hour from 3-6 is also worth taking advantage of.
Favorite beer is the chocolate stout

We love this place. We've been going for years because of the great food and awesome beer. Nice environment. If it's busy, it will take longer for service in the table area of the bar, but overall this is an excellent place.

The food is incredible, service is really good also. The waitress was very knowledable with the menu and was very polite. The deep dish pizza is definitely worth it, I have no problem going back there again for food. Anytime the food and service is top notch then it's a must to return.

Chicago Brewing Company is Legend-ary!

The fresh brews are all tasty. The Amber being superior. 

Upstairs is a nice cigar-friendly lounge complete with second bar, leather chairs, plenty of seating, and patios for fresh air. I've spent a lot of time at this bar and really enjoy the atmosphere.

I come often because it's a block away. If i have to walk, i will. Their house beer offerings have never really impressed me, but the food is really good. The king salmon dinner, the caprese salad, all amazing. 
Just recently I tried the blackberry wheat and Hopocalypse which were both incredible to me. The rest of the beer has been just ok. I know i'll be back again,lol

PS: no more late night happy hour :(

So the bartender upstairs is amazing, Jason is great always social always on top of his game! Couldn't have anyone here better because he does offer the beer selection on top of the alcohol selection. Very friendly & knows his regulars
The four stars are for the beer. Mr Cormier is a true craftsmen. The wife and I thought the food was unremarkable and somewhat bland. the service was fine.

This place offers a smoking and a non smoking side. The menu has a some Chicago favorites but not as many as you would think from the name. The beers are good and what you expect from brewery's today. Nothing I would go out of my way for, but good while you are there.
Had the nitro stout and it was exceptional. But now I feel sick from the gd smoke, even though we sat in the no smoking dining area. If you can't stand cig smoke, cross this place off your list.

This isnt my favorite restaurant by an means. I didn't have plans to go often in cravings for typical "bar food" , however I do like how they offer non smoking area. Tonight gave me another reason to come back more often, Rorke was one f the best servers I have had; constantly cleaned our area and kept our drinks full. So kind and patient highly recommend asking for him! Thanks man!!

Tonight I am having the Buffalo Mozzerella Salad for appetizer and BBQ Chicken Pizza for my main entre.

The salad was not bad.  I could have used more mozzarella and tomato.  Balsamic vinagarett was a reduction, I think.  Whatever it was, it was very good.  I shared it with my dinner mate.

The BBQ Pizza is amazing.  I like my BBQ sause sweet and the sause fitsthw bill. Everything is fresh and made to order.  The only hint I ammnot understaning is why thy pit corn on it.  I ordered it without the corn as I could not imagine it with corn.  The deep dish crust is amazing.  It is doughy and chewy and tastes great just like I like it.

Im conclusion, it was a great night with great food and great company.  You should have a good time.

Ps, they have beer to.

This was possibly one of the worst places I've eaten at based on the service and lackluster food. While you can see the wait staff walking around the restaurant constantly, don't expect them to check in too often. Repeatedly through out our meal, my boyfriend had to flag down people that were servicing other tables because our waitress was nonexistent. I wanted to split my meal with my boyfriend and no extra dish was given to do so. We ordered a pasta dish but, it was so bland we didn't finish it. At the end of the meal, due to our party size, we were charged an 18% gratuity. I can't justify 18% gratuity when I saw our waitress once to take our orders and a second time to disperse our meal. We also waited a tremendous amount of time for our meal (45 minutes). After all that waiting, our food was lukewarm/room temperature when it got to the table.

Not so Good, fries burnt other half not cooked.burger wasn't anything to talk about 
Tuna salad was Nasty Tuna was spoiled but they made good on it. 
U be better getting McDonald's and little ceazers pizza

To be honest, their house beer is "eh", but for the price it's really hard to go anywhere else. Especially during NFL season when you can get pitchers for $6!!! They have already helped provide a catalyst for my alcoholism. 

Also, the bar food is amazing and kitchen is open 24 hours.

It definitely is a local bar and every time I go in I see the "usual suspects" hanging around there, kinda like the Cheers bar :)

Stop in and have a drink...or don't, more beer for me.
